author: Mike Mentzer
text: To stimulate growth, the exercise must be brief, infrequent, and intense.

author: Mike Mentzer
text: Train harder, but briefer and less often. That’s the real key to maximum results.

author: Mike Mentzer
text: Progress is not made by training to failure every day. It is made by knowing when to step back and allow growth.

author: Dorian Yates
text: You hit failure, and you’ve got nothing left. That’s when it starts to count.

author: Dorian Yates
text: Discipline is doing what you hate like you love it.

author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
text: The last three or four reps is what makes the muscle grow. This area of pain divides a champion from someone who is not a champion.

author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
text: The worst thing I can be is the same as everybody else. I hate that.

author: Ronnie Coleman
text: Everybody wants to be a bodybuilder, but don’t nobody wanna lift no heavy-ass weight.

author: Muhammad Ali
text: I don't count my sit-ups. I only start counting when it starts hurting because they're the only ones that count.

author: Epictetus
text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.

author: Henry Rollins
text: The iron never lies to you. You can walk outside and listen to all kinds of talk... The iron will always kick you the real deal.

author: Franco Columbu
text: You can't be Mr. Olympia by just thinking about it. You have to train like a goddamn demon.

author: Tom Platz
text: Bodybuilding is not just a sport; it’s a way of life — a discipline, a religion.

author: Ronnie Coleman
text: Hard work and training. There’s no secret formula. I lift heavy, work hard, and aim to be better every damn day.
